channel.title: Posts on El Khalidi
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on El Khalidi

item.title: Mastering SQL for Data Scientists: A Comprehensive Guide
item.description: Welcome, aspiring data scientists! In this guide, we’ll embark on a journey through the essential SQL concepts that will empower you to wield the powers of data manipulation with finesse. From the foundational SELECT statements to advanced techniques like window functions and performance optimization, we’ll cover it all.

item.title: Purism Is In Big Trouble. Talks of Insolvency & Not Honoring Refunds.
item.description: Purism manufactures the Librem personal computing devices with a focus on software freedom, computer security, and internet privacy. Apparently they are struggling to still get their Librem 5 in peoples hands. They are ignoring people, and ignoring their requests for refunds.

item.title: A Polite Request for Linux Compatibility and Steam Deck Support for Deadside
item.description: I am writing on behalf of the Linux and Steam Deck gaming community to kindly request your consideration for two significant developments: Linux compatibility and Steam Deck support for Deadside.

item.title: How To Install Hugo, Add A Theme, & Deploy to GitLab Pages
item.description: I have had such a wonderful time using Hugo and I really do enjoy all of the things it allows me to do with ease. Even though there are plenty of fantastic guides for installing and configuring Hugo, I wanted to try my hand. Most guides or tutorials out there focus on deploying to Github or just don’t cover the topic at all.

item.title: Why I Opted For Hugo For My New Website
item.description: I want to shed some light on why I chose Hugo for the new website here and the reasons behind my decision to transition to this robust static site generator. I have been putting off Hugo as I wanted to get better at writing my own CSS from scratch. Now that I have given it a try, I cannot believe I waited so long!
